Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ma-shep (M. anguillicaudatus hepcidin, Cys-rich; natural AMPs, 4S=S, UCSS1a, fish, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: midgut, head kidney, and gill, the oriental loach,Misgurnus anguillicaudatus

Literature Information.Literature: Host expression:induced: treatment with a bacterial pathogen Aeromonas hydrophila induced the expression of Ma-Hep transcripts in loach midgut, head kidney, and gill.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (88.46%) tofish SA-hepcidin1C: 32%;  R: 12%; GRAVY: -0.156; M Wt: 2937.604; M formula: C117H187N39O31S9; mol ex coeff: 1990.Activity: active against E. coli (MIC 6 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 6 ug/ml), A. hydrophila (MIC 6 ug/ml), V. anguillarum (MIC 6 ug/ml), P. fluorescens (MIC 6 ug/ml), and beta-H. streptococcus (MIC 6 ug/ml). The universal low MIC values result from a non-standard assay by using a poor broth medium (1 % tryptone, 0.5 % NaCl).MOA:bacteria: kill bacteria by destroying bacterial cell membranes.Recombinant production:yeast:Pichia pastoris: it has been expressed.Microbiota regulation: Feed supplemented with Ma-sHep expressing yeast improved the intestinal flora of loach by increasing the dominant bacteria and decreasing the harmful bacteria.
Literature Information.Author: Jin Z, Shen M, Wang L, Wang C, Gao M, Yu G, Chang Z, Zhang X. 2023
Literature Information.Reference: Int J Biol Macromol. 2023 Jul 1;242(Pt 2):124833. doi: 10.1016/j.ijbiomac.2023.124833.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Antibacterial and immunoregulatory activity of an antimicrobial peptide hepcidin in loach (Misgurnus anguillicaudatus).
